title: Love Island Australia's Maurice Salib DENIES he was in a relationship
text:
Love Island Australia's Maurice Salib has denied being in a relationship before going on the show.

On Monday night, an article of his 'ex-girlfriend' Christie Swadling claiming he dumped her just two weeks prior to entering the villa, circulated through the group.

Asked by Cynthia Taylu as to when his last relationship was, the 27-year-old responded: 'My last serious relationship was like a year ago.'

'We were just seeing each other, it was never serious': Love Island Australia's Maurice Salib (pictured), 27, DENIED he was in a relationship before the show, on Monday night's episode

Maurice appeared unfazed as to the drama published in the 'Love Island Times'.

Walking around the villa in just a pair of briefs, the business owner picked up the magazine, laughed at the claims and said 'this is dumb'.

Quizzed by Cynthia and the rest of the group as to whether he was in a relationship before going on the show, Maurice insisted it was never anything serious.

Unfazed: An article of his 'ex-girlfriend' Christie Swadling claiming he dumped her just two weeks prior to entering the villa, circulated through the group. Maurice laughed off the claims

Denial: Asked by the group whether he was in a relationship, Maurice said: 'It was never really 'official official', no. We were just seeing each other, yeah'

Denial: Quizzed by Cynthia and the rest of the group as to whether he was in a relationship before going on the show, Maurice insisted it was never anything serious

'It was never really 'official official', no,' he said. 'We were just seeing each other, yeah.'

'Never boyfriend and girlfriend,' Maurice added. 'We were seeing each other, but it was never serious.'

Last Tuesday after the Love Island Australia season two premiere, 'jilted ex-girlfriend' Christie Swadling unleashed in a fiery tell-all uploaded to YouTube.

Jilted: Christie Swadling (pictured) claims he left her TWO WEEKS before going on the show - despite him saying he hasn't been in a serious relationship for a year

During the video, which is brazenly titled 'MY BOYFRIEND DUMPED ME FOR A DATING SHOW', Christie claimed that 'fame loving' Maurice called time on their romance two weeks ago, and said she was blindsided to soon discover he was a contestant on Love Island Australia.

'I'm getting so many messages from you guys asking what the hell is happening, and why are they seeing my 'boyfriend' all over the ads and everything to do with a dating show,' the Instagram model began.

'If you go and have a look you should be able to see from all my socials... I have been dating a guy for the past few months now named Maurice,' she explained.

'My boyfriend dumped me for Love Island Australia!' Last Tuesday, she unleashed, posting a fiery tell-all uploaded to YouTube

'In the past two weeks, everyone's realised he's not in my socials and then boom he's on this dating show,' the visibly-irate blonde huffed.

She proceeded to claim that Maurice had lied in his official Love Island bio when he claimed he's been single for six months.

'Did he lie in his bio? Yes. We were together within that [six month] time frame,' she declared.

She then turned to the question of whether she knew Maurice would be on Love Island before he dumped her.

We were together within that time frame!' In the video, she claimed that Maurice had lied in his official Love Island bio when he claimed he's been single for six months

'I had no idea he was going on the dating show, whatsoever. But he came to me while we were together saying that [Channel Nine had] asked him to go on the [television] ad [for Love Island].'

Explaining that Maurice has always had aspirations to become an actor, Christie said she didn't hesitate to encourage him to appear in the advertisement.

'He's wanted to be an actor, he does a little bit of acting as a side job. When the ad was released, everyone was messaging me saying, "Oh my god is Maurice going on Love Island?" And I was like, 'No it's just the ad he's just an actor",' she explained.

'He's wanted to be an actor!' Explaining that Maurice (right) has always had aspirations to become an actor, Christie (left) said she didn't hesitate to encourage him to appear in the advertisement

'About one week after he's gone on this ad, he's broken it off with me!' she exclaimed, adding that his sudden dumping was 'completely out of the blue'.

'His excuse was saying that he puts work first and he can't really prioritise me,' she said.

The social media star then addressed the question of whether Maurice had applied to appear on Love Island Australia while they were still dating.

Pointing out that the show is based in Fiji, Christie said: 'You have to apply for your visa two weeks before you travel there.'

'To me it makes no sense. He's ended love to go find love on the show': Maurice features prominently on Christie's Instagram page, and is seen in various amorous poses with the blonde

It's war! Christie savagely labelled Maurice (pictured) as 'trash' on Instagram during last Monday's premiere

'Maurice would have had to apply for his visa, keep his passport and apparently you even have to apply for the Love Island position itself months in advance.'

'So if that is all the case he would have 100 per cent have had to apply for this while we were together,' she added.

Maurice features prominently on Christie's Instagram page, and is seen in various amorous poses with the blonde.

The last photo of the couple was uploaded to her page in August.
description: Love Island Australia's Maurice Salib, 27, DENIED he was in a relationship two weeks prior to going on the show.
authors: Monique Friedlander For Daily Mail Australia
